channel.title: Chinese engineers visit the helicopter crash site
channel.description:
http://www.cnn.com/2011/WORLD/asiapcf/08/15/pakistan.china/
If this is true, those damn Navy SEALS should have destroyed the ENTIRE HELICOPTER.
What do you think the Chinese want or will do with this technology? Is this Pakistan's idea of revenge? Discuss.

item.title: Chinese engineers visit the helicopter crash site
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:4, topic:410290”][quote author=Bowser jr link=topic=511573.msg3712379#msg3712379 date=1313433189]
There is nothing to fear, China would start a war.
[/quote]
wat[/quote]
Ops, a little typo.
“China wouldn’t start a war.”
But I think US would be better with some Chinese overlords. Because no politician would try to fix the country.

Read full topic

item.title: Chinese engineers visit the helicopter crash site
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

They did destroy the entire thing, but the scraps were left over at the scene, and that is enough for China to study the stealth skin on the helicopter.

item.title: Chinese engineers visit the helicopter crash site
item.dc:creator: @Echo3 Echo_
item.description:
@Echo3 wrote:

edition.cnn.com

U.S. suspects Pakistan let China visit stealth chopper

The United States is concerned that Pakistan may have given China access to the high-tech helicopter that crashed in the U.S. raid on Osama bin Laden's compound, a U.S. official said.

If this is true, those damn Navy SEALS should have destroyed the ENTIRE HELICOPTER.

What do you think the Chinese want or will do with this technology? Is this Pakistan’s idea of revenge? Discuss.

Read full topic
